description: Dive into "Rawai's Coastal Bliss: Beach Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Rawai's Coastal Bliss: Beach Escapes

places.generalDescription: Kata Noi Beach, a hidden gem on Phuket's southwest coast, offers an idyllic escape with its stunning white sands and crystal-clear aquamarine waters. Nestled in a serene bay just south of the bustling Karon Beach, this beach is perfect for families seeking relaxation away from the party scene of Patong. The 1.5 km stretch is lined with swaying palm trees that provide shade while vendors offer refreshing drinks and local snacks right at your fingertips.

sources.snippet: Kata Noi Beach is a wonderful bay if you want to be near Kata, but stay away from the tourist herds. This beautiful strand of sand has clear blue water during the high season and was once voted one of the world‚Äôs most beautiful beaches. Fortunately, its ‚Äòout of the way‚Äô location keeps it relatively quiet, and unless you know about it, you probably will miss it.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Phuket Beaches ‚õ±Ô∏è

sources.snippet: Next and the last beach for me this day was Kata Noi beach, a beach 10 min walk away from Kata beach. Kata Noi is way smaller than Kata beach but I found it more charming. There were a lot of surfers there although there weren‚Äôt those many waves.
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

sources.snippet: Just a few minutes drive from Kata Beach, it's home to the Kata Thani Resort and Mom Tri's Villa Royale, yet retains a quiet feeling, mainly I think because the road goes nowhere!
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

sources.snippet: Kata Noi Beach, located in Phuket, is a smaller beach spanning about 700 metres with soft sand, crystal clear water, and lush green jungle backdrops.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Rawai

places.name: Kata Noi Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach ‚õ±Ô∏è  there where no swimming signs and it was choppy but it seems quite safe if you stay close. Not too crowded and very clean! Would 100% recommend

It is a quiet enough beach, without a lot of entertainment venues. Most often people come to this beach, stay in a hotel and try not to go far away, enjoying a quiet vacation.

The beach is small in size: its length is about 700 meters. In high season there are a lot of tourists here, but compared to the previous beaches: Kata and Karon, there is a place to stay!

Kata Noi beach is quite a famous vacation spot among tourists.

The flora here is made up of trees of mixed species, nevertheless, the beach is open enough to spread the sun's rays. Be sure to use high UV protection creams when sunbathing here.

The sand here is soft, light gray in color. The entrance to the sea is medium deep. The water is clear, blue-green color! The wind in the high season is not strong.

The bulk of vacationing tourists are concentrated at the hotels adjacent to the beach.

Full information with video and easy navigation - in the app üëâ PHUKETON

Kata Noi Beach is a stunning, quiet escape with soft golden sand and crystal-clear water. Less crowded than nearby beaches, it's perfect for swimming, sunbathing, or catching a breathtaking sunset.

Staying at Katathani Phuket Beach Resort makes the experience even better, with direct beachfront access, lush pools, and seaside dining. While the area has limited nightlife, it's ideal for a relaxing getaway.

‚úîÔ∏è Beautiful, clean, and quiet
‚úîÔ∏è Great swimming & incredible sunsets
‚úîÔ∏è Best enjoyed from Katathani Resort

‚ùå Few dining options nearby but couple very good options (BlueShark)
‚ùå Can be wavy in monsoon season when the waves/swell are coming from the west.

‚≠ê 5/5 ‚Äì Perfect for those seeking tranquility!

places.address: Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Karon Beach is a stunning 4-kilometer stretch of golden sand and crystal-clear waters, making it an ideal destination for couples and families seeking a more tranquil experience compared to the bustling Patong Beach, just 15 minutes away. This picturesque beach offers calm swimming conditions on serene days, while adventurous souls can enjoy the thrill of larger waves when the winds pick up.

sources.snippet: Karon Beach is known for its three-kilometer-long stretch of powdery white sand, clear turquoise waters, and unparalleled views of the Andaman Sea. Lastly, Cape Panwa Beach boasts stunning white powdery sand and an array of luxurious hotels and resorts, with close encounters with local marine life at the nearby Marine Biological Research Center and Phuket Aquarium.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Rawai

sources.snippet: Wedged between Patong (to the north) and Kata (to the south), it's the third longest beach on the island and one of the most popular. Karon beach boasts the typical soft, golden sand made famous by this region, and sea so turquoise it screams "holiday.". Much quieter than its sandy neighbors, this beach offers visitors a quieter, more laid-back experience.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Phuket | PlanetWare

sources.snippet: The next beach I saw on my journey south was Karon beach and seeing it from the hill was way better than seeing it from the beach itself. Because I was walking towards it, I found this amazing spot with a clear view of Karon beach, and the best viewpoint from the street. Near Centara Villas is where you will find this gorgeous view of Karon beach
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

sources.snippet: Karon Beach is the second-longest beach in Phuket and one of the most popular. The beach is an impressive stretch of white sand and clear blue water in high season, so vast that it never feels crowded. There are many good hotels across the main beach road, but Centara Grand Beach Resort is the only one with real beach access.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Phuket Beaches ‚õ±Ô∏è

sources.snippet: The beach is long, the sand is fine, and there are hotel options to suit everyone - 5 star to fan rooms in guesthouses... The beach area has been revamped over the last few years, and every time I hit Karon after coming from Patong I think "wow, this is nice".
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

places.name: Karon Beach

reviews.text: Clean water and sands. Less crowded than any beach you may wish to visit in Phuket. Few food stalls and activities.  The beach is huge and the waves are beautiful.
The sand here are soft and feel great. But the waves could be scary if you come at raining season. Sunset view is nice.

Nice beach to take the family out. The sunset is amazing here.

Lots of water sports activities are available here and across the beach there good spaces for parking the motorbike and lots of bars and restaurants to chillout and see the sunset.

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the serene southeastern coast of Phuket Island, Cape Panwa Hotel is a luxurious retreat that promises an unforgettable escape. This upscale resort features ten exquisite dining options and bars, ensuring guests can indulge in a variety of culinary delights. With two stunning outdoor pools and a rejuvenating spa, relaxation is at your fingertips.

sources.snippet: Panwa is a cape with three beaches: 1) Khao Kat Beach, 2) Ao Yon Beach and 3) the private Panwa Beach. Located on the East Coast but facing west, the area is home to luxury villas and a few resorts, a great alternative to relaxing away from the crowded beaches of the West Coast. Khao Kat Beach is not a swimming beach but has the charm of quiet bays, with several hotels along the bay.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Phuket Beaches ‚õ±Ô∏è

places.name: Cape Panwa Hotel

reviews.text:
My family and I stayed at Camp Panwa Hotel for five nights. The hotel and the rooms are clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Some minor issues that we had were fixed right away.
The breakfast was excellent; it was always fresh and varied.
That restaurant on the property is also good, with a good variety.
The beach is great, with a lot of shade, but the shore was a bit rocky-nothing that can't be fixed with proper water shoes.
In the hotel's vicinity are good restaurants, massage places, a pharmacy, and a grocery store.

Rather underwhelmed to be honest. 5 day stay family of 5 in 2 rooms with breakfast. Limited vegetarian options at breakfast and no halal options at all. Food signs taken away at 10.15am when breakfast is until 10.30am. Staff is rather miserable.

Beach is lovely and a good shuttle service running between 2 hotels until midnight. Unfortunately the tram that services hotel and beach was under maintenance the whole week we were here. Rooms were nice and big and housekeeping was good.

For the price certainly didn't feel like value for money.

The people, as in the staff, are second to none. So friendly and so attentive and welcoming. This resort is older but still fabulous. The rooms are very quiet, cool and comfortable. I think if I was to come again, I would get a villa with its own pool. The beach is so beautiful with crystal water and soft white sand. The pool is lovely. There is another pool and spa at the beach but it was always full of kids. You can find your own quiet spot as it is not busy here‚Ä¶ although my husband says as soon as I review things I wreck them, as then people go! The food is also fantastic and you really should lose weight before you come! We got a great package with food included. The band are lovely and some tourists that come often play along or have a sing. Everyone is so sweet‚Ä¶ except the tourists! They seem so unhappy but how could you be here? I highly recommend Cape Panwa Hotel‚Ä¶ and up the road so many great massages and stop in at the Sunset View bar for a beer and the view.

places.address: 27, 27/2 Mu 8, Wichit, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Yanui Beach, located on the west coast of Phuket just south of Nai Harn, is a small and secluded sandy beach surrounded by trees. Despite its unassuming appearance, it offers a serene atmosphere for activities like snorkeling and kayaking, especially during sunset. The beach is known for its clear waters and beautiful views of nearby islands. It's considered an ideal spot for families seeking a peaceful retreat away from the busier beaches on Phuket's main island.

sources.snippet: Nearby you have Phuket Orchid Farm, Sea Gypsies Village, Wat Sawang Arom, and a bit towards Nai Harn you can find the lovely small beach Ya Nui Beach. Activities you may find in these parts would include Batik Painting, Boat Renting, Horse Riding, Phuket Sports and Tennis Club, Thai Boxing, Thai Cooking Classes, and you also might find Spas, Thai Massage and Herbal Saunas an interesting experience, do visit : Atsumi Healing Centre, Poo's Sauna and Massage, Six-Sense Spa,The Solitude Spa at Mangosteen Resort.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach | Phuket Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Ya Nui Beach is tiny but has the charm of small beaches tucked in a cove between the Windmill Viewpoint and the famous Promthep Cape south of Phuket Island. It looks like a secret beach, but it is not, and many people come to enjoy it, especially for snorkelling and even beach diving. It‚Äôs just easy to miss it if it was not for the number of cars parked along the road.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Phuket Beaches ‚õ±Ô∏è

sources.snippet: A tiny little place just south of Naiharn beach, Ya Nui has a few bungalows which were rebuilt following the 2004 tsunami which hit this little beach hard. I have never seen more than a few dozen people here but it has got more popular recently. There are a few small restaurants just over the small road and good snorkeling around the rocks in high season.
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

sources.snippet: Ya Nui Beach is an unspoiled haven tucked away in a cove flanked by the Windmill Viewpoint and the renowned Promthep Cape. It is further magnified by its adjacent island Koh Man, which can be reached via kayaking expeditions. Rawai Beach is positioned at the southern tip of Phuket Island and is unique for allowing pet owners to bring their furry friends.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Rawai

sources.snippet: Located between Promthep Viewpoint and Windmill Viewpoint, Ya Nui Beach is beloved by both locals and tourists and it‚Äôs not hard to see why. You‚Äôll be wowed by the stunning beauty of this beach thanks to the natural formations you‚Äôll see here. It‚Äôs divided into two bays and you‚Äôll spot a large island (Koh Man) right in the middle.
sources.shortName: Our Ultimate Travel Guide [2025]

sources.snippet: Laem Ka beach is currently inaccessible by land, but is still accessible by sea and traditional boats from the fishing village of Rawai can take you there. It is one of the few east facing beaches in Phuket offering a beautiful light in the morning and a calm sea for swimming all year round.
sources.shortName: 10 reasons to choose Rawai Beach for your holiday in Phuket 2024

sources.snippet: Yanui beach is a small, secluded and natural beach without sunbeds, umbrellas and shops with commercial goods for tourists. With Phuket‚Äôs growth and development, such kind of natural beaches have become a rarity. A big advantage of Yanui beach is that it is easy to get here by car.
sources.shortName: Top beaches of Rawai, Phuket

sources.snippet: When Phuket people talk about Rawai they could be referring to the general area of south Phuket that starts just south of Chalong pier and includes Nai harn beach, Ya nui beach and Promthep cape. It‚Äôs a beautiful district with a sizable expat community.
sources.shortName: Rawai beach ‚Äì Snorkeling Thailand

sources.snippet: This might be one of the prettiest Phuket beaches I have seen from above. It can be seen from the area around Promthep Cape and from the Windmill viewpoint. Seeing it from above is the best as it reveals different tones of water colors.
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

sources.snippet: More a small cove than a beach, Ya Nui is a perfect beach for families. It's well sheltered (at the back), a palatable size, and one of the cleanest beaches on the island. Ya Nui also employs lifeguards.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Phuket | PlanetWare

places.name: ‡πçYanui Beach

reviews.text:
Ya Nui Beach is a charming cove located in the southern part of Phuket, Thailand. This small beach is celebrated for its picturesque scenery, featuring soft, powdery sand and clear, blue-green waters. Its natural beauty make it a favored spot for both relaxation and various water activities.

The beach's rocky areas and clear waters provide excellent conditions for snorkeling. One can explore vibrant marine life close to the shore, with snorkeling gear available for rent.

Visitors can rent kayaks and stand-up paddleboards. Paddling out to the nearby Koh Man island, situated roughly 700 meters offshore, is a popular activity when the sea is calm.

A couple of local restaurants are situated across the road from the beach, offering a variety of Thai dishes and refreshments.

Overall, Ya Nui Beach provides a serene and scenic environment, ideal for those seeking a more intimate beach experience with opportunities for adventure and relaxation alike.
A gorgeous beach which is fabulous for snorkelling with wonderful fish a couple of metres from the waters edge but the downside is the rubbish floating in the water which is so sad to see.

My visit to Yanui Beach in Phuket was a delightful escape from the island's busier spots.

Tucked between Windmill Viewpoint and Promthep Cape, this small, crescent-shaped cove offers soft golden sand and clear, turquoise waters perfect for a serene day out.

Arriving early via Bolt from Kata (15-minute ride, with 250-400 THB), the beach was tranquil, with hardly any crowds. Snorkeling around the northern headland and rocky promontory was fantastic, vibrant corals and fish abound, with gear rentals at 100 THB. Kayaking to Koh Man, a nearby island, was a highlight for just 100-150 THB/hour.

The beach's laid-back vibe, framed by lush hills, is ideal for families and couples. Two small restaurants across the road, like Royros, serve tasty Thai dishes (200 THB) and refreshing coconut drinks.

However, litter in the water was noticeable, and low tide exposes rocks, making swimming tricky. No sunbeds or umbrellas keep it unspoiled, but bring a towel for shade under trees. Parking is limited, so arrive early.

Despite minor drawbacks, Yanui's charm and proximity to stunning viewpoints make it a must-visit for a peaceful Phuket beach day.

places.generalDescription: Nikita's Beach Restaurant is a beloved dining spot situated on the picturesque Nai Harn Beach. It attracts both locals and visitors who are drawn to its diverse menu featuring a blend of Thai and international flavors, including delectable grilled seafood, pizzas, and pastas. The restaurant also boasts an array of cocktails and mocktails to accompany your meal. With its stunning views, Nikita's offers a laid-back atmosphere perfect for enjoying international cuisine by the beach.

sources.snippet: You can even head for favorites like ‚ÄúNikita‚Äôs‚Äù and ‚ÄúBaan Rimlai,‚Äù if you‚Äôre looking for something a little well-established. It is a beautiful place to have lunch or dinner situated under the trees with a spectacular view of other islands.
sources.shortName: A Newcomer's Guide to Rawai Beach

sources.snippet: For over 20 years, Nikita‚Äôs Beach Restaurant has been a favourite spot among expats and returning visitors. Set by the sea in the shade of huge trees near the Rawai pier, Nikita‚Äôs serves good Thai food and seafood at an excellent price.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How to make the best of your stay in Rawai?

sources.snippet: Salaloy: one of the first to restore Rawai beach, just after the Nikita, installed on the promenade. Authentic Thai cuisine, fresh seafood and all at Thai prices.
sources.shortName: 10 reasons to choose Rawai Beach for your holiday in Phuket 2024
Our Ultimate Travel Guide [2025]

places.name: Nikita's Beach Restaurant

reviews.text: We had a lovely dinner here and stayed to enjoy drinks afterwards. Nice staff and good service. Food was tasty. It's a pretty spot right on the water with a view of the pier. We definitely recommend!

Great restaurant on Rawai beach. Atmosphere is super chill and relaxing. Incredible views of the water and great breeze. The food was quite tasty as well. I think the Thai food was more flavorful than the western food. Also portions are a good size.

Fantastic location on the beachfront and the waiting staff provided impressive service throughout.

However I feel the need to point out the Phuket signature dish, crab meat curry, that disappointed as it contained a lack of curry paste, rather, it appeared to contain coconut milk. Also, the kale in oyster sauce lacked oyster sauce. I am very certain about these claims as I dined with Thai people. I asked for more curry paste but the dish came back basically the same.

places.address: 44, Beach, 1 Viset Rd, Rawai, Phuket, 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Kata Beach, a stunning gem on Phuket's southwest coast, is renowned for its picturesque 1.5 km stretch of soft white sand and crystal-clear turquoise waters. This idyllic location is perfect for swimming, snorkeling, and soaking up the sun. The beach is flanked by vibrant restaurants and resorts that cater to every need. Just a stone's throw away lies a community park designed for families seeking fun and relaxation away from the beach hustle.

sources.snippet: Rawai itself doesn‚Äôt seem to have a beach for sunbathing or swimming. However, local kids swim at each end while parents enjoy a picnic in the shade of trees. If you have booked in this part of the island, you can still find a decent sunbathing spot at the east end of the beach.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How to make the best of your stay in Rawai?

sources.snippet: Close to Chalong Bay and Naiharn beach, Rawai is full of small restaurants and food stalls and is a great place to rent a longtail boat to nearby islands. Not a swimming beach really, but makes a good stop off on a tour of the southwest corner of Phuket.
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

sources.snippet: Kata Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Phuket and for good reason. This stunning beach is an ideal spot for sunbathing, swimming, surfing, a...
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Rawai

sources.snippet: The beach was not that busy and apparently, you can rent a kayak here. I didn‚Äôt see this beach from above, so it didn‚Äôt impress me either.
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches
Rawai Beach Phuket - All You need to Know

places.name: Kata Beach

reviews.text:
Easily the most enjoyable beach experience if you head here slightly early in the day.

Tons of beach beds that are handled by the attendant, but also enough space at the ends to swim quietly and away from all things commercial.

The currents here are also a lot more manageable and do not pose as much of a safety risk as some of the other beaches. Could see a lot of families with young children enjoying themselves in the water.
Stunning beach at dusk. There were so many surfers and it was really pretty. Nice to walk along. A little dirty here and there but generally really well kept.

This beach had very calm and clean waters, fine sand ideal for making sand castles and clean enough for kids to play around with.
Family friendly place be it day or night. Ideal area to be with family.
Very relaxed environment, beach boys selling seats to tourists, helpful people around.

places.generalDescription: Rawai Beach, situated at the southernmost tip of Phuket, is a popular destination known for its fishing boats, picturesque views, and seaside dining options. It has been a tourist attraction since the early days of Phuket's tourism industry. The area is home to numerous hotels and restaurants offering delicious Thai and European cuisine at reasonable prices. Additionally, Rawai Beach provides easy access to Nai Harn Beach through a complimentary shuttle service.

sources.snippet:
The main attractions at Rawai for us personally would have
to be the great views of the offshore islands, the array of wonderful seafood
restaurants and the laid back lifestyle. At the northern end of Rawai beach near the Pier you will
find the Sea Gypsy Village and the popular Rawai Seafood Market. Here
you can purchase your seafood from the village markets and then take it to one
of the nearby restaurants where they are happy to cook it for a small fee.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach | What to do & Where to stay in Rawai

sources.snippet: Rawai Beach is most know for it's great seafood restaurants just next to the beach, and the place to take a long tail boat to one of the nearby islands, Racha Island, Koh Lone or Coral Island, or just go for fishing or snorkeling. There is two major resorts located here Evason and Mangosteen. The main attractions here would be Phuket Seashell Museum and Promthep Cape.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach | Phuket Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Visit the Phuket Shell Museum near Rawai Beach to dive into a diverse collection of rare seashells and marine artefacts. Marvel at exquisite specimens, including giant clam shells and delicate coral formations, showcasing the beauty and diversity of ocean life. Learn about the natural history of marine ecosystems and conservation efforts through informative displays.
sources.shortName: How To Reach, Best Time & Tips

sources.snippet: In the days before Phuket became a popular holiday destination, Rawai Beach was where locals from Phuket Town would come to enjoy the seaside. These days, the beach itself is not that nice with many small boats anchored off the shore, although it is safe to swim all year round due to its position facing Phang Nga Bay.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach Phuket - Beaches and Places

sources.snippet: It is just around 1 Hour drive from Phuket International Airport (50 Kilometers Distance). Next to this Beach, it‚Äôs Located one of the Best Spots and View Points in Phuket ‚ÄúPromthep cape‚Äù. it is Just around 5 minutes drive for a distance of 3 Kilometers.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach Phuket - All You need to Know
Rawai Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How to make the best of your stay in Rawai?

places.name: Rawai Beach

reviews.text: Quite place. Not overly populated (some areas still are in low season). Plenty of restaurants,  supermarkets,  convenience, and souvenir stores. Public benches are available to use. Beautiful panoramic views.

Unfortunately lots of plastic garbage :(

While the turquoise water looks absolutely stunning and you get to see the beautiful long boats, I wouldn't recommend this beach. There was no clean spot in the sand to sit down. Also, it was very noisy as there is a busy road right next to the esplanade.

This beach is a truly lovely spot, where you can enjoy the peaceful scenery and watch the colorful fishing boats under the sunny or cloudy sky. While you might not be able to swim, there's so much beauty to enjoy all around!

places.generalDescription: The Vijitt Resort is an upscale beach resort in Rawai, Phuket, offering plush villas with sea views and some featuring private pools. The elegantly appointed restaurant provides stunning views of Friendship Beach and live jazz music while serving a brunch buffet with a wide variety of delectable dishes. The rustic-looking rooms are designed for guest comfort and offer gentle sea breezes throughout the day.

sources.snippet:
The Vijitt Resort
is simply stunning; this all villa five star resort has a selection of
villas, pool villas and two bedroom pool villas that overlook Chalong
Bay. The resort has a range of top notch facilities including a stunning
infinity pool, a kids club, spa, and a complimentary shuttle to Nai
Harn Beach.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach | What to do & Where to stay in Rawai

places.name: The Vijitt Resort

reviews.text:
I thought I put up a review of this place, but I guess I didn't, so here goes. We stayed here in October of 2024 and absolutely LOVED it!!! The rooms were immaculate, great AC, the food from room service was fabulous, and the staff was amazing. We stayed in a villa with a private pool, which we loved. You can walk the grounds or simply call for a golf cart to take you around the resort; some of the areas are pretty steep. Tommy helped us book excursions and gave us ideas of what to do and where to eat while in Thailand. The breakfast buffet was really good, the bar drinks were good as well. The location was great. We booked several excursions, and we were always the first ones picked up for the tours because our location was more central, I think. The villa had 2 sides. One side with the living room, bathroom, and patio area. The other side is with the bedroom and bathroom and the shower (inside and oustide). Both sides have AC and tvs and access to the pool. Zero complaints, highly recommend.
*the food in the pictures are all from room service (different days). I didn't post pictures of local food spots because this is a review for the resort.

I had a wonderful stay at this beachfront hotel. The location was absolutely perfect, just steps away from the sea with stunning views. The staff were very friendly, attentive, and always willing to help with anything I needed. The room was clean, comfortable, and well-prepared. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing getaway with excellent service.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
The Vijitt Resort is absolutely beautiful - by far the best place I've visited in the Rawai area. I stopped by to check out the rooms as my mum is coming in a month, and the staff were incredibly kind, welcoming, and helpful. They took the time to show me around and made me feel confident in choosing this resort for her 21-day stay. I visited many other places in the area, but this one truly stood out. Highly recommended!

places.address: A, 16 Moo 2, Wiset Rd, Rawai, Muang, Phuket 83130, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Coral Island, also known as Koh Hey, is a must-visit gem in the Phuket region that promises an unforgettable day of adventure and relaxation. Just a short speedboat ride from Rawai Beach, this stunning island boasts pristine white sands and crystal-clear waters perfect for various water sports. Whether you're into snorkeling, scuba diving, or thrilling activities like parasailing and banana boat rides, Coral Island has it all!

sources.snippet: Rawai beach is good for food - most of the beach road is lined with small restaurants - and from Rawai you can get a speedboat or longtail boat to nearby islands such as Koh Bon, Coral Island, Racha Yai island. We did a trip last year from Rawai to explore the small island of Koh Kaew Yai which lies off the tip of Cape Phromthep and is a place of pilgrimage for Buddhists - there is a big Buddha statue on the island and a giant "Buddha footprint". Legend says that Buddha stepped onto the island before coming to the mainland of Phuket, where he first visited Rawai.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach | The Phuket Blog

sources.snippet: Coral Island has two beaches for you to explore and both can offer you a unique experience for the day. They‚Äôre called Long Beach and Banana Beach and since they‚Äôre both just 15 minutes away from Rawai Beach, why not drop by to check them out?. Long Beach is, as the name implies, a long strip of white sand with blue-green waters where you and your group can do some snorkelling, diving, and kayaking.
sources.shortName: Our Ultimate Travel Guide [2025]

sources.snippet: Rawai Beach is most know for it's great seafood restaurants just next to the beach, and the place to take a long tail boat to one of the nearby islands, Racha Island, Koh Lone or Coral Island, or just go for fishing or snorkeling. There is two major resorts located here Evason and Mangosteen. The main attractions here would be Phuket Seashell Museum and Promthep Cape.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach | Phuket Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Rawai is a centre for chartering boats for fishing and diving trips as well as for trips to the nearby islands such as Koh Lon, Koh Kaew, Koh Aeo, Coral Island and Koh Racha. There is also good snorkelling and diving round Laem Phrom Thep which is a short boat ride away. At low tide, collectors often come to Rawai looking for seashells.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach Phuket - Beaches and Places

sources.snippet: Coral Island is just 15 minutes away by longtail boats from Rawai. It consists of 2 beautiful beaches: Banana Beach, which can be rather crowded with tourists, and Long Beach, where the Coral Island Resort offers beach bungalows. Note that the Banana Beach on Coral Island is not the same as the Banana Beach on Phuket Island!
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How to make the best of your stay in Rawai?

sources.snippet: Visit nearby islands, such as Coral Island and Bon Island, or engage in snorkeling and island-hopping adventures for a day filled with maritime exploration.
sources.shortName: 10 reasons to choose Rawai Beach for your holiday in Phuket 2024

places.name: Coral Island

reviews.text:
Great spot for diving and more!
Insta: chachoux22 for more photo/video
It's can be quite touristy but I had an amazing time a lot of cool fish and coral all around that's why the name.
Only thing is that you pay for the taxi en then on the island you have to pay for the entry kinda of like a tourist trap but yeah..

Coral Island, also known as Koh Hae, is a stunning tropical paradise just a short boat ride from Phuket. The island boasts crystal-clear waters, soft white sand, and vibrant marine life, making it perfect for snorkeling, diving, and relaxing on the beach. The coral reefs are teeming with colorful fish, offering an unforgettable underwater experience. Several beachfront restaurants serve delicious Thai cuisine, allowing visitors to enjoy a meal with breathtaking ocean views. Whether you're seeking adventure or a peaceful escape, Coral Island provides a perfect blend of natural beauty and relaxation. A must-visit destination in Thailand!

Very beautiful beach to relax and snorkel. The water is clear and good for swimming.

You can get a long boat from Rawai beach and spend the whole day chilling by the beach.

You need to pay 100 thb per person to enter the beach. You get access to the beach and chairs to relax.

There is a bar, restaurant, and toilets at the beach.

places.address: Unnamed Rd Tambon Rawai Amphoe Mueang Phuket Chang Wat Phuket 83100Ê≥∞ÂõΩ, Tambon Rawai, Amphoe Mueang Phuket, Chang Wat Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Ko Racha Yai is a serene paradise where the absence of cars enhances its tranquil charm. This small island boasts a variety of resorts catering to different budgets, making it an ideal getaway for all types of travelers. With stunning sandy beaches and crystal-clear waters, visitors can indulge in relaxation or partake in water activities. The island's peaceful atmosphere is perfect for unwinding away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

sources.snippet: Rawai beach is good for food - most of the beach road is lined with small restaurants - and from Rawai you can get a speedboat or longtail boat to nearby islands such as Koh Bon, Coral Island, Racha Yai island. We did a trip last year from Rawai to explore the small island of Koh Kaew Yai which lies off the tip of Cape Phromthep and is a place of pilgrimage for Buddhists - there is a big Buddha statue on the island and a giant "Buddha footprint". Legend says that Buddha stepped onto the island before coming to the mainland of Phuket, where he first visited Rawai.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach | The Phuket Blog

places.name: Ko Racha Yai

reviews.text: Beautiful Island I'm not very far for Phuket. If you're stay overnight in the evening quiet.
If you wanna swim in clean and clear water away from the crowed place with amazing swimming sandy beach, highly recommended you to join Racha and coral islands tours.
Beautiful and crystal clear water here. Very quiet and strong waves.

places.generalDescription: Nui Beach, also known as Water Beach Club or Rock Swing Beach, is a secluded paradise located on the west coast of Phuket. Accessible through a coconut grove after Karon Viewpoint, this undeveloped sandy beach offers a peaceful holiday experience away from the tourist crowds. With limited facilities and fewer visitors compared to neighboring beaches, Nui Beach provides an unspoiled and tranquil environment for relaxation.

sources.snippet: Getting to Nui Beach is a little adventure but it‚Äôs worth it. The road to the beach is a hilly dirt road in the jungle. You can pass it by yourself or take a taxi at the exit of the main road.
sources.shortName: Top beaches of Rawai, Phuket

places.name: Nui Beach

reviews.text:
For anyone seeking a breathtaking, secluded beach with crystal-clear waters, Nui Beach is an absolute dream. The journey? A fun off-road adventure that only adds to the experience-unless, of course, you believe every paradise should come with a four-lane highway.

Now, let's clear up some misunderstandings: Nui Beach, like all beaches in Thailand, is part of the kingdom's natural beauty and is open to everyone. You're free to enjoy the sand and sea at no cost. However, the sunbeds, bar, and other facilities are privately maintained, and naturally, access to these comforts comes with a fee-just as you'd expect anywhere that provides quality service in a beautiful setting.

Some visitors seem surprised that a remote beach club isn't running as a charity, but for those who appreciate a well-kept paradise and don't mind supporting the people who make it special, Nui Beach is more than worth it. If adventure, exclusivity, and stunning scenery sound like your kind of day, you'll love it here as much as we did!

And a special mention: the owner's replies to brainrotted reviews are truly a gem of their own -some of the best communication I've seen, pure and honest. That alone makes this appreciation review worth writing. Recommended ü•∞

(If you disagree; get yourself checked, mentally.)

The beach itself is very cool...however be warned that the road to access it is not really a road but more of an off-road trail.  It's actually part of an ATV park.  I did make it on a scooter, so it is possible on a scooter or motorcycle, however I would not recommend this for a novice rider.  The terrain is very steep with lots of rocks and washouts.  Also be warned they have started collecting a fee to visit and a little man literally sprinted to me with his hand out to collect the 100 baht fee before I could even park and get off my bike.  They then added a 20 baht "parking" fee.  The whole thing was very scam-y.  In the big picture the fee and risk of personal injury is probably worth it to access the beach.  The whole place has a very pirate vibe with several bars and great picture points.  They have spent lots of time and energy to decorate it very well.  Overall...worth it...if you are aware of the risk and cost!

Quite the experience. Nui beach is a hidden gem. Whilst close to the busy Kata, you feel like in an other peaceful world. Far from the crowds, amazing views, crystal clear water, and lots of beautiful fishes if you fancy an improvised snorkeling session. The way to the beach is very steep and bumpy. So you might want to hike there (or drive you scooter if you have good suspensions). Also, locals provide 4x4 taxi and ATV services. The journey through the jungle is worth it.

places.address: Soi Laemmumnok, Karon, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Ra Wai Beach, located at the southern end of Phuket island, is renowned as the first tourist beach on the island. While not suitable for swimming, it offers stunning views of nearby islands and a tranquil local atmosphere. The beach serves as a departure point for boat tours to various islands and sightseeing spots in the surrounding sea. Visitors can enjoy fresh seafood at nearby restaurants and explore the local fishing community.

sources.snippet: Rawai Beach is positioned at the southern tip of Phuket Island and is unique for allowing pet owners to bring their furry friends. It is flanked by an ancient village belonging to the "sea gypsies," a once-nomadic and fishing-centric minority community. Nai Harn Beach is one of the most beautiful and unspoiled beaches in Phuket, thanks to the Samnak Song Nai Harn monastery that occupies a large portion of the beachfront land.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Rawai

sources.snippet: Rawai Beach is a great place for an evening walk along the sea or for a lunch or dinner near the water edge with the sounds of waves. You can enjoy stunning view to the small islands surrounding the south of Phuket and traditional Thai boats against the background of Andaman Sea. Rawai Beach is used as a pier for one-day boat tours to Coral Island, Racha Islands, Bon Island, etc.
sources.shortName: Top beaches of Rawai, Phuket

sources.snippet: This is not the beach where you go to lay in the sun and bath on the sea. The beach is filled with all types of boats and is basically where you should go to rent a longtail boat to visit nearby islands such as CORAL ISLAND. The beach is beautiful with amazing blue waters and has some waterfront restaurants that looked very appealing.
sources.shortName: Discovering the most beautiful Phuket beaches

sources.snippet: At the south end of Phuket Island, Rawai is not a swimming beach but offers beautiful views of the nearby islands. It is an anchoring point for the many longtail boats and speedboats going to Racha Island or Coral Island. It‚Äôs a great place to enjoy fresh seafood and a good starting point for island hopping.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Phuket Beaches ‚õ±Ô∏è

sources.snippet: Rawai Beach is renowned for its laid-back and peaceful ambiance, making it the perfect escape for those seeking relaxation amidst stunning natural beauty. Unlike its more bustling counterparts, Rawai retains an unhurried charm that allows visitors to unwind and connect with the unspoiled surroundings.
sources.shortName: 10 reasons to choose Rawai Beach for your holiday in Phuket 2024

sources.snippet: Close to Chalong Bay and Naiharn beach, Rawai is full of small restaurants and food stalls and is a great place to rent a longtail boat to nearby islands. Not a swimming beach really, but makes a good stop off on a tour of the southwest corner of Phuket.
sources.shortName: Phuket Beaches - Yes, we have a lot of Beaches!

sources.snippet: When Phuket people talk about Rawai they could be referring to the general area of south Phuket that starts just south of Chalong pier and includes Nai harn beach, Ya nui beach and Promthep cape. It‚Äôs a beautiful district with a sizable expat community.
sources.shortName: Rawai beach ‚Äì Snorkeling Thailand

places.name: Ra Wai Beach

reviews.text:
The beach is full of docked boats, making it unsuitable for sunbathing or swimming, but it provides a different kind of vibe.

I enjoy observing the numerous small animals without needing to dive.

The place is practically empty, tranquil, and serene. It's easily accessible; just park and enjoy a walk.

Surrounding environment is suitable for just sightseeing the vibe over there.  I wouldn't recommend for swimming or playing sand at here as you can see from the pictures there are a lot of boats and the nearly no place to walk nearby the ocean
Great for dining, walking and getting the vibe. Not suitable for a perfect sun and sand experience. Mainly boats with less space to swim or enjoy the nature.

places.generalDescription: Ao Yon Beach is a hidden gem nestled between Panwa beach and Cape Panwa in Thailand. Despite being relatively unknown, this tranquil beach offers a long stretch of warm sand and clear blue waters surrounded by tall palm trees. While it may not be as popular as other beaches on the west coast, Ao Yon boasts a serene tropical setting that is perfect for relaxation.

sources.snippet: Located approximately 6km from Phuket town in Thailand, Ao Yon beach is a stunning sandy shoreline consisting of two distinct parts separated by rocks...
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Rawai

places.name: Ao Yon Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach, there are fewer people there. You can swim even when the tide is low. The sun hides behind the hill earlier than on other beaches in the area, around 5:30 PM. The part behind the rock is better (not the small beach by the road), it is larger. Access is from the small beach by the road to the right along the stones. Parking is easy to find.

Beautiful, quiet, cozy beach with a length of about 650 meters. Even in high season, it is not crowded and you can find a place to relax without much trouble!

There are low tides on this beach (- * follow the tides in the appendix), but they are not as strong as on Ravai beach and the opportunity to swim here is almost always preserved.

Some hotels located on the beach have sunbeds and umbrellas. You can talk to the hotel staff and rent them.

The flora of the beach is made up of sparse plantings of deciduous trees and palm trees, and at the beginning and end of the beach are towering mountains with a stone base.

The sand here is hard, light gray in color! The entrance to the sea is average in depth and depends on the time of day! The water in the sea is not the most transparent, has a greenish tint due to the presence of plankton.

Full information with video and easy navigation - in the app üëâ PHUKETON

Super peaceful, with soft sand and calm vibes ideal for sunbathing, reading, or just relaxing without the usual noise. No jet skis or water sports blasting around, which makes it even better if you just want to chill.
What's also great is that you can hop on a boat to Coral Island (Koh Hae) from here super convenient if you want to explore a bit more. Definitely one of my favorite spots for a slow, easy beach day

places.address: 5/13 Soi Ao-Yon Khaokhad, Wichit, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Salaloy Seafood, situated on Rawai Beach in the southern part of Phuket, offers a unique dining experience. Divided into two parts, with the main dining room and kitchen on one side and a spacious outdoor area by the ocean on the other, it provides a welcoming atmosphere under tall trees and cool sea breezes. Popular among locals, expats, and tourists alike for its Thai dishes and seafood offerings, this restaurant stands out for its clean ambiance.

sources.snippet: Salaloy Seafood Restaurant in Rawai offers an excellent seaside dining experience with ocean views and a cool breeze under immense trees. The restaurant is always busy, especially during lunch and dinner, and even more since its inclusion in the Michelin Guide. Known for its extensive seafood menu with fish, prawns, shells and crabs, the restaurant offers authentic local food at reasonable prices.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach ‚õ±Ô∏è How to make the best of your stay in Rawai?

places.name: Salaloy Seafood

reviews.text:
Food and service was superb. As usual, most Thai food are too sweet in my opinion. The soft shell crab in curry and egg and seafood cooked in coconut is exceptionally good. Two of my fav Thai food.
Indoor and outdoor seating available. Food was served fast and hot.

I guess this is one interesting seafood restaurant that you should visit. I have not enough time to explore another interesting restaurant around here. The staff and services are so good and friendly. The foods have many options and are delicious. I can feel freshy of their foods.  The restaurant has two types of table services as with the roof, and under the tree. It is such a perfect combination and location for  dining and enjoying your drinks beside the sea views and atmosphere. I can say that I wanna be here again.

We came here especially for big portion of fired rice which is avaliable in three sizes: S, M and L. With chicken the portion S cost (Feb 2025) 80b, M for 180b and L 250b. M is shown on the picture and it was BIG! Only thing that it tasted like regular rice fried with egg, no any other seasoning or veggies which you can find from other local places in fried rice. Chicken was moist, but there wasn't plenty of it. Seems that portion grows by rice, not by add-ins.

They charge for glass of ice 10b, so be aware when ordering drinks.

Food arrived really quick.

places.address: 52, 2 Wiset Rd, Rawai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83130, Thailand
